intro: Myrcia prolaxa, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 6 meters in height. The plant has glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a red, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Myrcia prolaxa is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
